001package _Point_Fitting;
002
003import java.util.Random;
004
005import ij.IJ;
006import ij.ImagePlus;
007import ij.ImageStack;
008import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
009import ij.plugin.PlugIn;
010import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
011import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
012import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
013import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
014import imagingbook.pub.geometry.fitting.AffineFit2D;
015import imagingbook.pub.geometry.fitting.LinearFit2D;
016import imagingbook.pub.geometry.fitting.ProcrustesFit;
017
018/**
019 * This IJ plugin creates a set of K random points, which are
020 * displayed in the first frame of a 2-image stack.
021 * The point set is transformed by a (fixed) affine transformation,
022 * the result is shown in frame 2.
023 * All point coordinates are integers, the transformed coordinates are rounded
024 * to their closest values.
025 * Then a linear fit is found between the two point sets, using either
026 * (a) an affine fitter or
027 * (b) a Procrustes fitter.
028 * The correspondence between the point sets is known.
029 * 
030 * @author WB
031 * @version 2020/03/17
032 *
033 */
034public class Affine_Transform_Fitting_Demo implements PlugIn {
035        
036        static int W = 400;
037        static int H = 400;
038        static int K = 200;                     // number of points
039        
040        static double dX = 18.688;
041        static double dY = -7.123;
042        
043        static double S = 1.05;         // uniform scale factor
044        static double alpha = 20;       // rotation angle (in degrees)
045        static double sigma = 0.0;      // amount of additive Gaussian position noise 
046        
047        static boolean allowTranslation = true;
048        static boolean allowScaling = true;
049        static boolean forceRotation = true;
050        
051        static final String title = Affine_Transform_Fitting_Demo.class.getSimpleName();
052        
053        private static final String[] FittingMethods = {"Affine Least Squares", "Procrustes"};
054        private static int theMethod = 0;
055        
056        // -------------------------------------------------------------
057
058        public void run(String arg) {
059                if (!runDialog())
060                        return;
061                        
062                IJ.log("Fitter used: " + FittingMethods[theMethod]);
063                
064                double a = alpha * Math.PI / 360;
065                double[][] A =          // affine 2D transformation matrix
066                        {{ S * Math.cos(a), S * -Math.sin(a), dX },
067                         { S * Math.sin(a), S *  Math.cos(a), dY }};
068                
069                IJ.log("\nA (original) = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
070                
071                // create the image stack
072                ImageStack stack = new ImageStack(W, H);
073                ImageProcessor ipP = new ByteProcessor(W, H);
074                ImageProcessor ipQ = new ByteProcessor(W, H);
075                stack.addSlice(ipP);
076                stack.addSlice(ipQ);
077                
078                // create K random points and draw them in ipP:
079                Random rg = new Random();
080                Point[] P = new Point[K];
081                for (int i = 0; i < K; i++) {
082                        int u = W/4 + rg.nextInt(W/2);
083                        int v = H/4 + rg.nextInt(H/2);
084                        P[i] = Point.create(u, v);
085                        ipP.putPixel(u, v, 255);
086                }
087                
088                // transform points P -> Q
089                Point[] Q = new Point[K];
090                for (int i = 0; i < K; i++) {
091                        double[] q = Matrix.multiply(A, Matrix.toHomogeneous(P[i].toArray()));
092                        // we add Gaussian noise and round to simulate a discrete grid transformation:
093                        int u = (int) Math.round(q[0] + rg.nextGaussian() * sigma);
094                        int v = (int) Math.round(q[1] + rg.nextGaussian() * sigma);
095                        Q[i] = Point.create(u, v);
096                        ipQ.putPixel(u, v, 255);
097                }
098                
099                new ImagePlus("Stack", stack).show();
100                
101                // select a fitter:
102                LinearFit2D fitter = null;
103                switch (theMethod) {
104                case 0: fitter = new AffineFit2D(P, Q); 
105                                break;
106                case 1: fitter = new ProcrustesFit(P, Q, allowTranslation, allowScaling, forceRotation); 
107                                break;
108                }
109                
110                double[][] Af = fitter.getTransformationMatrix().getData();
111                IJ.log("\nA (estimated) = \n" + Matrix.toString(Af));
112                IJ.log(String.format("\nRMS error: \u03B5 = %.6f", Math.sqrt(fitter.getError())));
113        }
114        
115        // -------------------------------------------------------------
116
117        private boolean runDialog() {
118                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(title);
119                gd.addNumericField("Image width (W)", W, 0);
120                gd.addNumericField("Image height (H)", H, 0);
121                gd.addNumericField("Number of points (K)", K, 0);
122                gd.addNumericField("Translation in x (dX)", dX, 2);
123                gd.addNumericField("Translation in x (dY)", dY, 2);
124                gd.addNumericField("Rotation angle (degrees)", alpha, 2);
125                gd.addNumericField("Uniform scale factor (s)", S, 2);
126                gd.addNumericField("Position noise (\u03C3)", sigma, 2);
127                gd.addChoice("Fitting method", FittingMethods, FittingMethods[theMethod]);
128                gd.showDialog(); 
129                if (gd.wasCanceled()) 
130                        return false;
131                W = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
132                H = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
133                K = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
134                dX = gd.getNextNumber();
135                dY = gd.getNextNumber();
136                alpha = gd.getNextNumber();
137                S = gd.getNextNumber();
138                sigma = gd.getNextNumber();
139                theMethod = gd.getNextChoiceIndex();
140                return true;
141        }
142
143}
